name: Spring Boot
description: Spring Boot is a popular Java-based framework for building microservices and web applications.

name: Hibernate
description: Hibernate is an object-relational mapping (ORM) library for Java that provides a framework for mapping an object-oriented domain model to a relational database.

name: Maven
description: Maven is a build automation tool used primarily for Java projects. It helps manage dependencies, build processes, and project documentation.

name: JUnit
description: JUnit is a popular unit testing framework for Java. It provides annotations and assertions to write and run tests.

name: Apache Kafka
description: Apache Kafka is a distributed streaming platform that is commonly used for building real-time data pipelines and streaming applications.

name: Guava
description: Guava is a set of core libraries developed by Google for Java programming. It includes collections, caching, primitives support, concurrency libraries, common annotations, string processing, I/O, and more.

name: Lombok
description: Lombok is a Java library that helps reduce boilerplate code by automatically generating getters, setters, constructors, and other repetitive code.

name: Log4j2
description: Log4j2 is a logging framework for Java applications that provides logging capabilities with various configuration options and performance improvements over its predecessor, Log4j.

name: JPA (Java Persistence API)
description: JPA is a Java specification for accessing, persisting, and managing data between Java objects/entities and a relational database. It provides a standard way to map Java objects to database tables and vice versa.

name: Swagger
description: Swagger is an open-source tool that helps design, build, document, and consume RESTful web services. It provides a user-friendly interface for defining API specifications in the OpenAPI Specification format.

name: Gson
description: Gson is a Java library from Google that can be used to convert Java Objects into their JSON representation and vice versa. It can handle complex Java objects with nested objects and collections.

name: Tomcat
description: Apache Tomcat is an open-source web server and servlet container that is widely used to deploy Java web applications. It provides a robust environment for running Java web applications.
